  • WebGLRenderer

Class WebGLRenderer

Pluggable WebGL-based rendering strategy for a Viewer.

Handles creation and rendering of geometry and materials for a Viewer, using the browser's WebGL 3D graphics API.

Usage

 
import {Viewer, WebGLRenderer} from "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@xeokit/xeokit-viewer/dist/xeokit-viewer.es.min.js";

const myViewer = new Viewer({
    id: "myViewer",
    renderer: new WebGLRenderer({
         textureTranscoder: new KTX2TextureTranscoder({
             transcoderPath: "./../dist/basis/" // <------ Path to BasisU transcoder module
         })
    })
});

Constructors

constructor

  • new WebGLRenderer(params: { textureTranscoder?: TextureTranscoder }): WebGLRenderer
    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/webgl/WebGLRenderer.ts:97

    Creates a WebGLRenderer.

    Parameters

    • params: { textureTranscoder?: TextureTranscoder }

      Configs

      • Optional textureTranscoder?: TextureTranscoder

        Injects an optional transcoder that will be used internally by SceneModel.createTexture to convert transcoded texture data. The transcoder is only required when we'll be providing transcoded data to SceneModel.createTexture. We assume that all transcoded texture data added to a SceneModel will then be in a format supported by this transcoder.

    Returns WebGLRenderer

createModel

  • createModel(params: SceneModelParams): SceneModel

  • Implementation of Renderer.createModel

    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/webgl/WebGLRenderer.ts:196

    Returns a new SceneModel that will be stored and rendered by this Renderer.

    The SceneModel provides an interface through which we can then build geometry and materials within it. Once we've built the SceneModel and called SceneModel.build, the Renderer will immediately begin rendering it all Views that we registered previously with Renderer.registerView.

    When we've finished with the SceneModel, we then call SceneModel.destroy to destroy it.

    Parameters

    • params: SceneModelParams

    Returns SceneModel

  • Implementation of Renderer.deregisterView

    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/webgl/WebGLRenderer.ts:193

    Deregisters the View with the given handle.

    The Renderer will then cease rendering for that View.

    Parameters

    Returns void

registerView

  • registerView(view: View): number

  • Implementation of Renderer.registerView

    • Defined in packages/viewer/src/webgl/WebGLRenderer.ts:157

    Registers a View with this Renderer.

    The Renderer will then begin rendering each SceneModel created with {@link SceneModel.createModel} for the new View.

    You can only register as many Views as indicated in ViewerCapabilities.maxViews, as returned by Renderer.getCapabilities.

    Parameters

    • view: View

    Returns number

    A handle for the View within this Renderer.
